page.title: 05Wildlife of Cannock Chase
page.content: There are many {animals} on Cannock Chase, including deer, foxes, badgers, stoats, weasels, grey and red squirrels and even adders and toads. Many rabbits also live there. They sometimes feed on the bark and shoots of trees and can kill trees by "ring-barking"; that is gnawing a circle of bark right round the trunk. Grey squirrels can sometimes be seen jumping from tree to tree. There are a few red squirrels in the coniferous woods. {Fallow deer} can sometimes be seen in the quieter areas. There are many of the common {birds} to be seen, as well as the woodland birds such as woodpeckers, tree-creepers, and nuthatches. There are many more animals and birds on Cannock Chase and they are all very beautiful and interesting.
